verses.verse: But it <S%H3415>displeased<s%> <S%H3124>Jonah<s%> <S%H1419>exceedingly<s%>, and he was very <S%H2734>angry<s%>.

And he <S%H6419>prayed<s%> unto the <S%H3068>Lord<s%>, and <S%H559>said<s%>, I <S%H577>pray<s%> <S%H3068>you<s%>, O Lord, was not this my <S%H1697>saying<s%>, when I was yet in my <S%H127>country<s%>? Therefore I <S%H1272>fled<s%> <S%H6923>before<s%> unto <S%H8659>Tarshish<s%>: for I <S%H3045>knew<s%> that you are a <S%H2587>gracious<s%> <S%H410>God<s%>, and <S%H7349>merciful<s%>, <S%H750>slow<s%> to <S%H639>anger<s%>, and of <S%H7227>great<s%> <S%H2617>kindness<s%>, and <S%H5162>repent<s%> of the <S%H7451>evil<s%>.
Therefore <S%H3068>now<s%>, O Lord, <S%H3947>take<s%>, I beg <S%H5315>you<s%>, my life from <S%H2896>me<s%>; for it is better for me to <S%H4194>die<s%> than to <S%H2416>live<s%>.
Then <S%H559>said<s%> the <S%H3068>Lord<s%>, Do you <S%H3190>well<s%> to be <S%H2734>angry<s%>?

So <S%H3124>Jonah<s%> went <S%H3318>out<s%> of the <S%H5892>city<s%>, and <S%H3427>sat<s%> on the east <S%H6924>side<s%> of the <S%H5892>city<s%>, and there <S%H6213>made<s%> him a <S%H5521>shelter<s%>, and <S%H3427>sat<s%> under it in the <S%H6738>shadow<s%>, until he might <S%H7200>see<s%> what would become of the <S%H5892>city<s%>.

And the <S%H3068>Lord<s%> <S%H430>God<s%> <S%H4487>prepared<s%> a <S%H7021>gourd<s%>, and made it to come <S%H5927>up<s%> over <S%H3124>Jonah<s%>, that it might be a <S%H6738>shadow<s%> over his <S%H7218>head<s%>, to <S%H5337>deliver<s%> him from his <S%H7451>grief<s%>. So <S%H3124>Jonah<s%> was <S%H1419>exceedingly<s%> <S%H8055>glad<s%> of the <S%H7021>gourd<s%>.

But <S%H430>God<s%> <S%H4487>prepared<s%> a <S%H8438>worm<s%> when the <S%H7837>morning<s%> <S%H5927>rose<s%> the next <S%H4283>day<s%>, and it <S%H5221>struck<s%> the <S%H7021>gourd<s%> that it <S%H3001>withered<s%>.

And it came to <S%H8121>pass<s%>, when the sun did <S%H2224>arise<s%>, that <S%H430>God<s%> <S%H4487>prepared<s%> a <S%H2759>hot<s%> <S%H6921>east<s%> <S%H7307>wind<s%>; and the <S%H8121>sun<s%> <S%H5221>beat<s%> upon the <S%H7218>head<s%> of <S%H3124>Jonah<s%>, that he <S%H5968>fainted<s%>, and <S%H7592>wished<s%> in <S%H5315>himself<s%> to <S%H4191>die<s%>, and <S%H559>said<s%>, It is <S%H2896>better<s%> for me to <S%H4194>die<s%> than to <S%H2416>live<s%>.

And <S%H430>God<s%> <S%H559>said<s%> to <S%H3124>Jonah<s%>, Do you <S%H3190>well<s%> to be <S%H2734>angry<s%> for the <S%H7021>gourd<s%>? And he <S%H559>said<s%>, I do <S%H3190>well<s%> to be <S%H2734>angry<s%>, even unto <S%H4194>death<s%>.

Then <S%H559>said<s%> the <S%H3068>Lord<s%>, You have had <S%H2347>pity<s%> on the <S%H7021>gourd<s%>, for the which you have not <S%H5998>labored<s%>, neither made it <S%H1431>grow<s%>; which came up in a <S%H1121>night<s%>, and <S%H6>perished<s%> in a <S%H1121>night<s%>:

And should not I <S%H2347>spare<s%> <S%H5210>Nineveh<s%>, that <S%H1419>great<s%> <S%H5892>city<s%>, where <S%H3426>are<s%> <S%H7235>more<s%> than <S%H8147>sixscore<s%> <S%H7239>thousand<s%> <S%H120>persons<s%> that cannot <S%H3045>discern<s%> between their right <S%H3225>hand<s%> and their left <S%H8040>hand<s%>; and also <S%H7227>much<s%> <S%H929>cattle<s%>?
